title: 1882 Providence team cabinet card with Ward, Radbourn, Harry & George Wright
author: ramram

posts.post_title: 1882 Providence team cabinet card with Ward, Radbourn, Harry & George Wright
posts.post_content:
1882 Providence team image with Ward, Radbourn, Harry & George Wright.  

Rob M.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=906&d=1243525970[/IMG]
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=907&d=1243525993[/IMG]

Rob M:

I'll take it. Please e-mail payment instructions to: [url]vguerrerobb@yahoo.com[/url]

Thanks,

Phil Garry

Phil- you just picked up one beautiful cabinet card. Congrats!

Note also the appearance of Vincent Nava, a very significant and early player of color (I think he was Cuban). That cabinet has always been a favorite of mine.

Barry, I'm pretty sure Sandy Nava was of Mexican descent. Also, in the above cabinet whomever wrote the names at bottom misidentified Radbourn, he is the one with his hand on Harry's shoulder not the guy on the far right.
-Rhett
Thanks Rhett. I thought he was Cuban, but I wasn't sure.
Beautiful cabinet photo.  I guess Providence didn't go for the "Clown costumes" of 1882 or this photo was taken later in the season when most leagues had dropped the idea.
